Title: Object: Souvenir d'Egypte (Breton well)
Series: Les Artistes Anciens et Modernes
Description: Plate 192: Egyptian landscape, with in the foreground, the bank of a river where a cow is lying down, and on the opposite bank, lush vegetation including palm trees; in the distance two shapes resembling minarets; after Prosper Marilhat Lithograph on grey chine collé
Curator's comments: The Bibliographie de la France has an entry which appears to describe this print: "19 mars 1859, no. 526 -- Souvenir d'Egypte, paysage, par {Laurens}, d'après {Marilhat}. Paris, imp. lith. {Bertauts}." but IFF 18 dates the six prints from "Les Artistes Anciens et Modernes" 1854-1857. For further information on the series, including dating, see Curator’s Comment on 1936,0302.14.1. For another impression, a proof before letters, see 1876,1111.532.
Bibliographic references: IFF / Inventaire du Fonds Français: Bibliothèque Nationale, Département des Estampes (18)
Acquisition notes: 1880,0710.1 to 250 constitute a series of plates for 'Les artistes anciens et modernes' from 1842-60.
